chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Mr. T's new belt is huge! When he's inside it (internal), his feet no longer touch the ground!
humanum_full_description_en:
"Shuowen": "Inside, enter. From the mouth, enter from the outside." "Shuowen Jiezi Zhu": "Nowadays people say that where you enter is inside, it is based on its extended meaning. Yoshiya."

A dot is added in the middle of the Chinese character "入" to decorate the inscriptions. Later, the dot stretches out into a horizontal painting, forming a " big " shape.

There are five usages in bronze inscriptions: one, means entering, E Jun Qizhou Festival: "𨑗 (upper) river, inner (enter) Hunan." Second, means inner, Mao Gongding: "Men (you) follow my country and my home." . Third, to express contribution, Yu Hou Ding: "Yu Hou Yu Fang Nei (Na) Feng (Li) Yu Wang." Fourth, pronounced " Rui ", the name of the ancient country, Nei Da Zi Bai Yan Gai: "Nei (Rui) Da (Prince) son Bai Zha (made) 簠". Fifth, it is used as the official name, such as "Internal History" is a historical official.
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle bone inscriptions change from "冂" to "入", while inscriptions are mostly from "宀" to "入". This configuration is still retained in many simple and silk scripts. "宀" is a room, and " enter " means a symbol to enter the room. The original meaning is to enter the house, and it is extended to be inside, inside and outside.
humanum_full_description:
《說文》：「內，入也。從口，自外而入也。」《說文解字注》：「今人謂所入之処爲內，乃以其引伸之義爲本義也。」

　　金文於「入」字中間加一圓點為飾，後來圓點伸展為橫畫，形成「大」形。

　　金文用法有五：一，表示進入，鄂君啟舟節：「𨑗(上)江，內(入)湘。」二，表示內裏，毛公鼎：「命女(汝)辥我邦我家內外」。三，表示貢獻，噩侯鼎：「噩侯馭方內(納)豊(醴)于王。」四，讀作「芮」，古國名，內大子白簠蓋：「內(芮)大(太)子白乍(作)簠」。五，用作職官名，如「內史」是史官。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「冂」從「入」，而金文則大都從「宀」從「入」，這一構形於不少簡帛文字中仍被保留。「宀」是居室，「入」表示進入室內的符號，本義是進入屋內，引申為內裏、內外之內。

《說文》：「內，入也。從口，自外而入也。」《說文解字注》：「今人謂所入之処爲內，乃以其引伸之義爲本義也。」 金文於「 入 」字中間加一圓點為飾，後來圓點伸展為橫畫，形成「 大 」形。 金文用法有五：一，表示進入，鄂君啟舟節：「𨑗(上)江，內(入)湘。」二，表示內裏，毛公鼎：「命女(汝)辥我邦我家內外」。三，表示貢獻，噩侯鼎：「噩侯馭方內(納)豊(醴)于王。」四，讀作「 芮 」，古國名，內大子白簠蓋：「內(芮)大(太)子白乍(作)簠」。五，用作職官名，如「內史」是史官。
"Shuowen": "Inside, enter. From the mouth, enter from the outside." "Shuowen Jiezi Zhu": "Nowadays people say that where you enter is inside, it is based on its extended meaning. Yoshiya." A dot is added in the middle of the Chinese character " 入" to decorate the inscriptions. Later, the dot stretches out into a horizontal painting, forming a " big" shape. There are five usages in bronze inscriptions: one, means entering, E Jun Qizhou Festival: "𨑗 (upper) river, inner (enter) Hunan." Second, means inner, Mao Gongding: "Men (you) follow my country and my home." . Third, to express contribution, Yu Hou Ding: "Yu Hou Yu Fang Nei (Na) Feng (Li) Yu Wang." Fourth, pronounced " Rui", the name of the ancient country, Nei Da Zi Bai Yan Gai: "Nei (Rui) Da (Prince) son Bai Zha (made) 簠". Fifth, it is used as the official name, such as "Internal History" is a historical official.

內字的基本解释

內
nèi
同“内”。

內字的汉语字典释义

[①]［nèi］
［《廣韻》奴對切，去隊，泥。］
亦作“內1”。
(1)里面，里头。与“外”相对。
(2)指使向内、向里。
(3)室，内室。
(4)指居屋的正室。
(5)帝王所居之处；皇宫。
(6)指朝廷。
(7)宫门或闺门以内的人和事。
(8)指家务。
(9)妇女；女色。
(10)古代泛称妻妾。后专称妻。
(11)称妻家的亲属。参见“内兄”、“内侄”。
(12)内心。
(13)指内脏。
(14)亲近。
(15)谓不形于外；暗地里。
(16)指正道。佛教徒称佛门之内的为内，佛门之外的为外。
(17)返，回头。参见“内顧”。
(18)戈戟刃下接柄之处。
(19)退。
(20)犹中。指五行方位的中央。参见“内色”。
[②]［nà］
［《集韻》諾答切，入合，泥。］
亦作“內2”。
(1)“納”的古字。使进入；放入。
(2)“納”的古字。接纳；容纳；釆纳。
(3)“納”的古字。迎娶。
(4)“納”的古字。交纳；进献。

內字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【入字部】　內； 康熙笔画：4； 页码：页125第35
〔古文〕?【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?奴對切，餒去聲。【說文】入也，从冂入，自外而入也。【玉篇】裏也。【增韻】中也。【易·坤卦】君子敬以直內，義以方外。又【前漢·鼂錯傳】先爲築室家，有一堂二內。【註】二房也。【韻會】房室曰內，天子宮禁曰內。漢制，天子內中曰行，內猶禁中也。唐有三內，皇城在長安西北隅，曰西內。東內曰大明宮，在西內之東。南內曰興慶宮，在東內之南。又五內，五中也。【魏志·王浚傳註】聞命驚愕，五內失守。又職內，官名。【周禮·天官註】職內，主人也。若今之泉所入，謂之少內。又河內，地名。【周禮·夏官·職方氏】河內曰冀州，其山鎭曰霍山。又【集韻】【正韻】?儒稅切。同汭，水相入也。或省文作內。又【正韻】同枘。【周禮·冬官考工記註】調其鑿，內而合之。又【正韻】奴荅切。同納。【孟子】若已推而內之溝中。

考證：〔【周禮·夏官·職方氏】河內曰冀北。〕　謹照原文冀北改冀州。

甲骨文金文小篆楷体

Inside
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［nèi］
["Guangyun" slaves cut, go to the team, mud. ]
Also known as "Inner 1".
(1) Inside, inside. Contrast with "outside".
(2) Directing inward and inward.
(3) Room, inner room.
(4) Refers to the main room of a HOS flat.
(5) The place where the emperor lived; the imperial palace.
(6) Refers to the imperial court.
(7) People and things within the palace gate or boudoir gate.
(8) Refers to housework.
(9) Women; female sex.
(10) In ancient times, it was generally called wives and concubines. Later specifically called his wife.
(11) Called relatives of his wife's family. See also "brother" and "nephew".
(12) Inside.
(13) Refers to internal organs.
(14) Get close.
(15) Said invisible to the outside; secretly.
(16) Point the way. Buddhists call what is within Buddhism is inside, and what is outside Buddhism is outside.
(17) Go back, look back. See "Inside Gu".
(18) The place where the handle under the halberd blade.
(19) Retreat.
(20) Yuzhong. Refers to the center of the five elements. See "Inner Color".
[②]［nà］
["Jiyun" promised to cut, enter and mud. ]
Also known as "Inner 2".
(1) The ancient word for "na". Make into; put in.
(2) The ancient word for "na". To accept; to accommodate; to accept.
(3) The ancient word for "na". Marry.
(4) The ancient word for "na". Pay; contribute.
